Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great and friendly service and fair rate”
Reviews.Author: braje747
Reviews.Content: Pice /Quality ratio was perfect. Very nice Hotel. Would certainly return again!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and Absolutely Soulless”
Reviews.Author: DanishAccent
Reviews.Content: Relaxa Stuttgarter Hof is one of those forgettable hotels you have everywhere. It seems well run, it's efficient, catering to business men who want a bed and a reliable internet connection. Period. So if that's all you want, this hotel is fine. Anhalter Strasse, by the way, is as bland as the hotel itself, but it's close to a station without a direct connection to the airport, so you can definitely stay there if you're infatuated with chain hotels. However, the breakfast brunch was really, really good!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here if you're in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: tophams186338
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel Joerg and his team looked after us so well. The service, location, food and room were all fantastic and we'll definitely be back if we stay in Berlin. All the staff were excellent and the standard of housekeeping was first class, our room was spotless. If you go to Berlin you've got to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: HauEurope
Reviews.Content: Well, the overall judgment is “medium”. The hotel is undoubtedly located at walking distance from the city centre. The price is not so high. The level of cleanliness of the rooms is not standard (I mean, it is below) for a 4-stars hotel. As far as ethics and socio-cultural aspects are concerned, part of the staff appears somewhat corrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: SuirTripper
Reviews.Content: Cant speak highly enough of this hotel. Excellent location, friendly & helpful staff, clean & large room facing into the rear courtyard of the hotel. Hotel is right around the corner from checkpoint charlie, berlin wall memorial and a straight walk down the street from Potsdammer Platz. There is an S bahn stop at the end of the street however we found that we could easily walk to most of the sights. We didnt eat at the hotel so cannot comment on food/restaurant. We'll be back here again & will definately stay in the relaxa again

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean business hotel”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located close to Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn and not far from the Kochstrasse U-Bahn (Checkpoint Charlie). It's a business hotel apparently geared towards conferences and functions, but it's suitable for leisure travelers as well. We were in a superior room (upgrade due to booking 3 nights), which was spacious and comfortable, although it looked like it had been furnished by Ikea: very much standard issue light beige furniture, nothing different, interesting or special. However, the price was excellent given the location and the quality of the accommodation, so can't really complain. Not a memorable stay, but fully satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: mr_mark_i
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel (close to transport and therefore close to everything in Berlin) that was very clean, spacious and very comfortable. Great buffet breakfast. A very nice place to stay in Berlin. After seven days, it was difficult to leave.... An easy walk to Potsdamer Platz, the old wall and Checkpoint Charlie etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bergeje
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, excellent breakfast. We stayed there 4 nights around the New year celebration. Really nothing to complain about. English newspaper available and for smokers a smoking corner (no need to go outside). Well located. Walking distance from all major intereting spots.

Reviews.Title: “a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: CanariesPA
Reviews.Content: In Berlin for a recent conference, we were put up at the Relexa. We found it clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were (mostly) impressively multilingual (unlike us) and the room well-organized if not luxurious. There was a small balcony overlooking the (vaguely overgrown) park that fronts the Relexa's street. The bathroom was plenty large and the shower - esp by European standards - outstanding. There was a room safe that held a laptop. The hotel is located well for Checkpoint Charlie and is walkable to the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate. Public transport is close and reliable. Quibbles include a soft bed; overly expensive in-room internet (though it is free in the lobby); and a rather cramped breakfast area (breakfast itself is an interesting buffet, very German. Which is a compliment - it is not a bland selection.) But these are minor issues, irrelevant even for some travelers.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: draculaisfromdublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 1/3 to 4/3 and although it was not our first choice we were very pleasntly surprised because we stayed for three nights we received an upgrade to a superior room. turn right as you exit the hotel and checkpoint charlie is only 4 minutes walk. turn left and the s-bahn is only 50 metres away. there are two or three restaurants at this end of the street. but turn right outside the hotel and right at the end of the street 100 metres up on the lefthand side is an excellant steakhouse with very good food and reasonable prices.we had 250 gram fillet steak with baked potato and green beans and garnish for about 18 euro a head. i think it was called steakhouse assador either spanish or argentinian.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Relexa in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: UCSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at this hotel in late September. As others have mentioned it is on a street with numerous other hotels. We had no issues with street noise, as we asked for a quiet, non-smoking room. The hotel provided us with a room that overlooked a park shared by a number of apartment buildings. The room was quiet, clean and meet our expectations. The hotel primarely caters to European business people and Eurpean tourists. While I speak German, my wife does not, but she had no problem speaking with the staff in english. They were very helpful in answering our questions. The loaction is excellent, as all of the major sites in the Mitte section of Berlin are either within walking distance or a short S-Bahn train ride away. I would recommend this hotel for its location, clean rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGLeeds
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay at this lovely hotel. The room was bright and airy, with a comfortable bed and spotless bathroom - in fact this was one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful, catering for all tastes. The location is perfect; a pleasant stroll to all main sights or very handy for the U and S Bahn. There are lots of excellent eating places nearby. Our favourite was the Steakhaus Asador, just round the corner on Wilhelmstrasse (turn right at the top of Anhalter - look out for the fairy lights on the left).

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: NatashaDublin
Reviews.Content: I had a great weekend in Berlin (apart from choosing this hotel), I was there for the Anniversary of 50 years of the EU so loads going on. I would definately go back but not to this hotel. Don't get me wrong the location was great, close to Check Point Charlie and to all Public Transport. The only problem was the hotel, firstly this is rated as a 4 star hotel and there is no way this is a 4 star hotel and just to note we certainly paid 4 star prices. The Bedrooms are unbelievably small, we actually asked to be moved but there were no rooms available due to a conference being held that weekend. Our bedroom was at the front of the hotel and the noise from the busy road all through the night was terrrible. It also states that they have a gym, there are only 4 excercise machines here, it like the bedrooms is far too small. Most of the staff OK but there was one in particular when we were checking out that was just so rude. Breakfast is just OK, the continental style. There are alot more hotels to choose from and I would not recommend this one, simply because it is far too overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful city,wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: delboythekopite
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 4 nights at relexa stutgarter hof and could'nt fault anything about the hotel and its staff.Breakfast was plentiful and a good variety.Because we stayed for 4 nights we received an upgrade to a superior room.Excellent facilities and close to S bahn station for easy access to berlin city centre.Would recommend anyone buying a travel ticket that gives you travel on bus and train.Berlin is such a wonderful city that i cannot wait to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “berlin a wonderful friendly place”
Reviews.Author: colin&judi
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel for very reasonable money the staff were extremely friendly and helpful as everyone in Berlin was .The hotel rooms were large airy very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was superb if a little unorganised.The position of the hotel was also excellent.,between 2 underground lines and on a good circular bus route close to Check Point Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate.Six of us all adults used this hotel from 7th to 11th december 2006 and we all would thorouly recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok but not the best”
Reviews.Author: TheRealMiL
Reviews.Content: My stay here was adequate. Advertised as 4 star, it was really more of a 3 star hotel. Rooms facing the road were to have special ventilation systems; mine was not working, so they gave me a fan, which was a cheesy fix. The carpets were dirty, but otherwise it was clean, and the breakfast was good, lots of it and some variety. The location is great, and the neighborhood was very safe. Total plus: a rubber duckie in the bathtub! I really WANTED to like the hotel a lot more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Both Very Cool and Too Warm”
Reviews.Author: ovelho
Reviews.Content: A very nice place, helpful staff, good location, but wasn't quite all we hoped. We wanted a twin room which apparently they don't have so we had only one queen bed---crowded for two big people. The weather was very hot, and the rooms have no air conditioning or fans. We thought such a modern **** hotel would have AC, even though many hotels in Germany do not. The big window/door did open widely to the courtyard, which helped, but there wasn't much breese most of the time. The location is close to the S Bahn, but that's a separate system from the U Bahn, so it was usually helpful only to get to Potsdamer Platz where we walked to the U Bahn station. Breakfast was very good and INCLUDED, which it wasn't at other hotels we reserved via Expedia, Hotels, etc.(where it cost 15-18 euros EACH) The hotel was generally very clean and well decorated, EXCEPT....the rooms have yellow carpeting which shows every little spill and stain, and there were lots of them. It gave an otherwise spotless room an unpleasant impression. Berlin's a great city---very modern and very historic, with people from all over the world!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relexa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Relexa Hotel in Berlin. It had all the amenities we were looking for and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our triple room was comfortable, clean and attractive. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we've seen in Europe. Conveniently located near the S Bahn, Checkpoint Charlie and the remaining part of the Berlin Wall, it is an ideal homebase for tourists. I am recommending this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “highly recomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacobL
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the relexa Stuttgarter Hof Hotel in Berlin where we enjoyed a very pleasant stay. Everything was just great: the room (a superior one due to our relatively long stay)not very big but comfortable, well aranged with nice new furniture and very clean, same thing about the bathroom, very good breakfast, perfect service, free internet in the lobby, gym, sauna etc. Good location, within walking distance from Potsdammer Platz and Friedrichstrasse (checkpoint Charlie)and of course near S-bahn (Anhalter Bahnhof) and bus.

Reviews.Title: “memories are made of this”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: memories were made when we visited berlin march 2006 and stayed at this hotel.Spotlessly clean, ensuite and superior bedroom/ great buffet breakfast with lots of healthy choices/ convenient to the great railway infrastructure in berlin.Had a thoroughly wonderful 4 day break and would recommend this hotel. Quiet and peaceful at night if that is what you are looking for.Staff attentive and friendly without being intrusive.Managed to get a good price deal also. Would also highly recommend the English Bike Tour situated at the bottom of the TV tower at Alexanderplatz.

HotelInfo.Name: Relexa Hotel Stuttgarter Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Anhalter Strasse 8-9, 10963 Berlin, Germany
